channel.title: First time using Hyperion
channel.description:
My friend and I are starting a new project, so I decided to use Hyperion. The only problem is, the version I have uses a feature that Java7 offers, which is switch statements for Strings. Here is an example of one: [code=java] switch (args[0].toLowerCase()) {[/code] I've already set my IDE to use JDK7 to compile with, but I'm still getting the following error: [i]Cannot switch on a value of type String. Only convertible int values or enum constants are permitted[/i]
Help is much appreciated.

item.title: First time using Hyperion
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

What IDE are you using? I know in Netbeans you also have to set the specific project to use JDK 7.

Read full topic

item.title: First time using Hyperion
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

My friend and I are starting a new project, so I decided to use Hyperion. The only problem is, the version I have uses a feature that Java7 offers, which is switch statements for Strings. Here is an example of one:

switch (args[0].toLowerCase()) {
I’ve already set my IDE to use JDK7 to compile with, but I’m still getting the following error:
Cannot switch on a value of type String. Only convertible int values or enum constants are permitted

Help is much appreciated.

Read full topic
